metadata.Title: CVE-2019-5786 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Object lifetime issue in Blink in Google Chrome prior to 72.0.3626.121 allowed a remote attacker to potentially perform out of bounds memory access via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-5786` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 72.0.3626.121-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 72.0.3626.121-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 72.0.3626.121-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 72.0.3626.121-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 72.0.3626.121-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '72.0.3626.121-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
